name: Design Research Reconciliation
description: Validates that the design system is thematically authentic, has no cross-essay collisions, is complete enough to guide implementation, and is not generic/derivative. Produces a reconciliation audit artifact with structured pass/fail.

all_of.description: Design research report (must exist and be reconciled)

any_of.description: Reconciliation audit report with structured header

validations.description: Design research must not contain [UNRECONCILED] marker
Design research must not flag aesthetic collisions with other essays
Reconciliation audit must not have FAIL status in frontmatter

notes: G4.1 runs THREE audits on DESIGN-RESEARCH.md: (1) Thematic Authenticity — every color/font/animation traces to subject matter, (2) Cross-Essay Novelty — no collisions with other essays, (3) Document Completeness — every component in the invocation spec has corresponding design tokens, every visualization has implementation-ready specs. The reconciliation agent also performs a slop prevention check (originality screening) before the design gets built. The audit artifact must include a YAML frontmatter header per the Gate Accountability Standard. See orchestration/standards/gate-accountability.md.
